relationships.description: Nikolic is forwarding news content to Epstein
Co-founders of Partners in Health who worked together on global health initiatives
Friend and former dean at Harvard School of Public Health

transactions: Borrowing of drugs from Brigham pharmacy
World Bank TB loan to Russia

analysis.purpose: To forward a news article about Jim Yong Kim's nomination for World Bank president and his work with Partners in Health
analysis.significance: Shows communication between Nikolic and Epstein regarding a significant political appointment and global health initiatives

concerns: Unauthorized borrowing of $92,000 worth of drugs from hospital pharmacy

notable_quotes: "Paul and Jim would stop at the Brigham pharmacy before they left for Peru and fill their briefcases with drugs. They had sweet-talked various people into letting them walk away with the drugs."
"The world changed yesterday," he wrote from Geneva to all of PIH.
red_flags: Unauthorized removal of pharmaceutical drugs worth $92,000

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this document

illegal_activity.description: Document is forwarding a news article about Jim Yong Kim's work, not containing first-hand illegal activity by the sender or recipients

details: Massoud Hayoun article from The Atlantic

public_knowledge.context: Jim Yong Kim's World Bank nomination was major international news in 2012, and his work with Partners in Health was well-documented in public media

analysis.summary: Boris Nikolic forwards a news article to Jeffrey Epstein about Jim Yong Kim's nomination as World Bank president, detailing Kim's work with Partners in Health combating tuberculosis epidemics in Peru using unconventional methods including borrowing drugs without authorization.
